Good afternoon:

Given the forecast and timing of tomorrow's potential weather, the District has elected to go with a delayed start of one hour for Thursday, Jan. 17. Busses will run 1 hour later than normal. Classes will begin at 9:00 in all schools.

Road conditions in the Tremont area are generally pretty good despite all of the recent snow. However, there are several inches of snow piled up along the shoulders and some areas create a few additional issues for our buses. With a forecast of ice and snow on top of what has already been received, we'd like to plan now for the delay. The extra hour will ensure more time for preparations around the building, sunlight for our drivers, and an additional hour to assess weather conditions regarding a full cancellation.

Thank you for your cooperation. It's not always possible, but our hope is that the early decision can assist families with the adjustments necessary in the morning routine.

Jeff Hinman
Superintendent
Tremont CUSD #702

The Baker family is special to to our school community and our thoughts and prayers are with them during this difficult time.

post_text: The County Facilities Sales Tax is on the November 6 ballot. Several informational meetings were held the past few weeks. The local Board of Education has agreed to property tax reduction by lowering the tax rate 30 cents on bond debt should the measure pass. Groceries, medicines, cars, trucks, and farm equipment are among the items NOT part of this tax. Revenue (that can only be used for facilities, some infrastructure needs, safety upgrades, and debt reduction) stays local and would be distributed by the Regional Office of Education.
